strings.Value: "Regongar, what is this? Why are you drunk when we're ready to march?"
"Pack, and do it fast. We have to go."
"Reg, you idiot! What are you doing?! Do you realize you're letting the whole party down?"
"In this condition you're not just useless, you're dangerous. Let's push the march for half a day until you come around."
"I don't care about your excuses. Pack, and fast!"
"All right, Reg, suck it up. Stop fooling around, I need you. I don't know how, but in ten minutes you'll be ready to go. Got it?"
"I don't care about your excuses. Are you all right? We are marching off."
"Exactly, you usually aren't. Reg, I'm seriously worried about you. What's going on?"
"Another stunt like this, and you'll be sitting in the capital until you're an old man! You realize you let down the whole party?"
"What was that nonsense about no one needing you?"
"When you were drunk, you said no one needs you. Another stunt like this, and I'll start thinking about whether or not that's true."
"Hunh? W-What? Are we going already? I'm — a... I'm — almost ready!" {n}Regongar's tongue is heavy. He's swaying visibly, and his breath reeks of alcohol.{/n}
"I... I was just sitting at night... And, well... Thinking about things... And the flask... I kind of didn't notice... And here I am."
{n}Regongar gathers his things clumsily, and leaves the encampment with the others.{/n}
"I'm... I'm sorry". {n}The half-orc stumbles to his tent.{/n}
"Yes... I always let everyone down. Octavia and you and... Everyone. Just leave me somewhere... In the gutter! That's where I belong!"
"Y-You do? Are you sure? Got... Got it! I'll just be a second!"
{n}Regongar is still not quite sober, but now he's able to walk steadily and speak coherently.{/n} "You know... I'm sorry. I didn't mean to... you know, I'm usually not like this."
{n}The half-orc shakes his head.{/n} "I'm just... Damn it! I'm sorry, I'm just an idiot."
"I'm ready. Let's go."
"I do." {n}The half-orc lowers his head.{/n}

"I couldn't sleep for half the night. Kept thinking about how much pain I stupidly caused Octavia — and now you too probably. I was thinking — maybe you'd both be better off without me? Stupid thoughts! I sipped from the flask to drive them away — and got drunk little by little... Ah, there is no point in any excuses. Forget my babbling. Just forget it. And forgive this idiot. I swear, I won't have another drop while we're on the march!"
"You know what? Leave me and go. You don't re... Hic... Really need me. What good am I? I ruin... Everything, right... Why do you even keep me around?"
{n}The half-orc bites his lip fiercely.{/n} "The truth, I guess… What the sober man thinks, the drunkard reveals."
{n}Regongar nods gloomily.{/n} "Got it. My fault. Not another drop on the march!"
